paragraphs.text:
%md

You can run any cell by entering it by clicking on it and hitting "shift-enter" or run all cells using the "play" button in the tool bar on the left.

The first cell is to delete the students table if necessary. You can use this to drop the table as needed.

# NB
When you first start zeppelin in the browser you may need to click save at the bottom of the list of "interpreters" which appear in buttons.

msg.data:
You can run any cell by entering it by clicking on it and hitting “shift-enter” or run all cells using the “play” button in the tool bar on the left.

The first cell is to delete the students table if necessary. You can use this to drop the table as needed.

NB

When you first start zeppelin in the browser you may need to click save at the bottom of the list of “interpreters” which appear in buttons.

paragraphs.text:
case class Mark(value: String)

object Marks {
  val A = Mark("A")
  val B = Mark("B")
  val C = Mark("C")
}

case class Course(name: String)

case class Grade(course: Course, mark: Mark)

case class Student(name: String, yearOfBirth: Int, yearOfEnrolment: Int, mark: Int, grades: List[Grade])

val students = List(
Student("Jane", 1989, 2016, 91, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.A))),
Student("Joe", 1992, 2016, 85, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.B))),
Student("Jim", 1994, 2016, 84, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.B))),
Student("James", 1991, 2016, 58, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.C))),
Student("John", 1989, 2016, 92, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.A))),
Student("Jemma", 1989, 2016, 92, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.A))),
Student("Jon", 1992, 2016, 85, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.B))),
Student("Jimbo", 1994, 2016, 85, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.B))),
Student("Jamie", 1991, 2016, 58, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.C))),
Student("Johnson", 1989, 2016, 92, List(Grade(Course("Big Data"), Marks.A)))
)


// spark context
val rdd = sc.parallelize(students)
val df = rdd.toDF

// df.show

val ds = spark.createDataset(rdd)

// val ds: Dataset[Student] = df.as[Student]


ds.map(s => s.mark)

df.write.option("path", "/tmp/students").mode("overwrite").saveAsTable("students")

paragraphs.text:
%md

-- calculate the mean of the marks
-- calculate the mode (the most common mark)
-- calculate the range of marks (clue: the maximum minus the minimum)
-- calculate the upper and lower quartile marks (namely the mark at 25% and 75% of the range)

Use %sql as the cell type. Click the cog icon in top right of cell to perform commands such as to add another cell or to move cells up or down.

– calculate the mean of the marks
– calculate the mode (the most common mark)
– calculate the range of marks (clue: the maximum minus the minimum)
– calculate the upper and lower quartile marks (namely the mark at 25% and 75% of the range)

Use %sql as the cell type. Click the cog icon in top right of cell to perform commands such as to add another cell or to move cells up or down.
